data.q: Which browser storage mechanism persists data even after the browser is closed?
data.explanation: localStorage persists data until it is explicitly cleared by the user or application.

data.q: Which storage is scoped to a single browser tab?
data.explanation: sessionStorage is cleared when the browser tab or window is closed.

data.q: Which storage option is best suited for large structured data?
data.explanation: IndexedDB is designed for storing large amounts of structured data efficiently.

data.q: Which API allows storing data as key-value string pairs?
data.explanation: localStorage stores data as string-based key-value pairs.

data.q: What is a key limitation of cookies compared to other storage options?
o: They are sent with every HTTP request
data.explanation: Cookies are sent with every HTTP request, impacting performance and security.
IndexedDB supports transactions for reliable data operations.
